Package housewifei

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • housewifei.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColdSensor, ControlledHeater, ControlledLight, InfraredCamera, LightSensor, RadioReceiver
    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    housewifei.Controller Object Used to represent sensors, receptors, controllers and actuators alike. Needs a valid server and environment to be run in a thread.
    Author:
    Alexe Simon and Mawait Maxime

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()
        Default Constructor. Sets state and pin to 0. A valid server and environment must then be added for this controller to be run in a thread.

      • Controller

        public Controller​(int starting_state,
                  int pin,
                  ServerNotifier server,
                  EnvironmentSimulation environment,
                  java.lang.String description)
        Constructor with starting state, pin, server, environment and description parameters.
        Parameters:
        starting_state - The starting state of this controller.
        pin - The pin the controller is connected to.
        server - The notifier of the server this controller is connected to.
        environment - The environment simulation of this controller.
        description - The description of this controller.

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Returns the internally saved state of this controller. Does not update it beforehand.
        Returns:
        The internally saved state of this controller without updating it.

      • setState

        public void setState​(int state)
        Setter for internally saved state. Should only be used in pure testing, software environment. See changeState(int).
        Parameters:
        state - The new state of this controller.

      • getPin

        public int getPin()
        Returns the pin on which this controller is connected.
        Returns:
        The pin on which this controller is connected.

      • setPin

        public void setPin​(int pin)
        Sets the pin on which this controller is connected. Does not update any supposedly connected server.
        Parameters:
        pin - The new pin.

      • getServer

        public ServerNotifier getServer()
        Returns the server notifier on which this controller is connected.
        Returns:
        The server notifier on which this controller is connected.

      • setServer

        public void setServer​(ServerNotifier server)
        Sets the server notifier on which this controller is connected. Does not update any supposedly connected server.
        Parameters:
        server - The new server notifier.

      • getEnvironment

        public EnvironmentSimulation getEnvironment()
        Returns the environment simulation connected to this server.
        Returns:
        The environment simulation connected to this server.

      • setEnvironment

        public void setEnvironment​(EnvironmentSimulation environment)
        Setter for environment simulation. Should only be used in pure testing, software environment.
        Parameters:
        environment - The new environment simulation of this controller.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Description getter.
        Returns:
        The String description of this controller.

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription​(java.lang.String description)
        Changes the description of this controller.
        Parameters:
        description - The new description.

      • changeState

        public boolean changeState​(int state)
        Commands the housewifei.Controller to change its hardware state. Also updates current environment simulation if connected to. Pure sensors/receptors should not use this command.
        Parameters:
        state - New state to be changed to.
        Returns:
        True if state change was detected, false if not.

      • updateState

        public boolean updateState()
        Commands the housewifei.Controller or Receptor to update its state to correspond to environment state.
        Returns:
        True if a change in environment was detected and the state changed. False otherwise.

      • updateGetState

        public int updateGetState()
        Commands the housewifei.Controller or Receptor to update its state to correspond to environment state and return it.
        Returns:
        The state of the housewifei.Controller or Receptor after environmental update.

      • isState

        public boolean isState​(int state)
        Compares argument received with the state saved internally.
        Parameters:
        state - State to be compared with the internal state.
        Returns:
        true if equal, false else.

      • updateIsState

        public boolean updateIsState​(int state)
        Similar to isState(int), but updates beforehand.
        Parameters:
        state - State to be compared with the internal state.
        Returns:
        true if equal, false else.

      • startController

        public void startController()
        Starts the controller thread.

      • stopController

        public void stopController()
        Stops gracefully the controller thread.

      • run

        public void run()
        Generic controller thread. Observes its environment, and notifies its server when a change was detected.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
